text:
159 Hicks Street, east side, between Clark Street and Love Lane. A view of the Stephen Brophy house. It was razed in 1890.

1888.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

Clark Street, at the S.W. corner of Hicks Street, showing the house in which Henry Ward Beecher passed away in 1887. It has now (1936) been razed.

1900.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

118-122 Hicks Street, at the N.W. corner of Clark Street. Willow Street is seen in the background. The first house on the corner was the home of Robert Hicks of the Poughkeepsie Hicks family. Later Mr. Greigen owned the three houses. They were razed in 1922.

1921.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

123-153 Hicks Street, east side, near Clark Street. The building in the foreground, was used partially in 1828 by the Brooklyn Collegiate Institute; and in 1842 it was known as the Mansion House. It was razed in 1930.

April 1925.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

137 Hicks Street, east side, between Clark Street and Love lane. A view of the Mansion House Hotel, Brooklyn's oldest hotel, now 120 years old. December 1925.

Brown Brothers.

124-140 Hicks Street, near the S.W. corner of Clark Street.
February 5, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1) 144-154 Hicks Street, west side, between Clark and Pierrepont Streets. February 5, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Hicks Street (right), south of Clark Street, showing a general view south from the Hotel St. George.

June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

A general view north from the Hotel St. George, No. 51 Clark at Hicks Streets, showing Hicks Street (left), south of Orange to Fulton Streets. In the foreground, is the Plymouth Church, beyond it on Cranberry Street, is the Assumption R.C. Church. The streets shown from fore to background are: Orange, Cranberry, Middagh and Poplar Streets. Between the last mentioned streets, is P.S. No. 2.

June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - Brooklyn - Clark Street - Hotel St. George.

text:
A general view north west from the Hotel St. George, No. 51 Clark at Hicks Streets, showing the Hotel Margaret, at the N.W. corner of Columbia Heights and Orange Street. To the right of the Hotel, is No. 72 Furman Street, occupied by the National Cold Storage Co. Beyond, is the East River, the Brooklyn Bridge and the skyline of lower Manhattan.

June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - Brooklyn - Clark Street - Hotel St. George.

text:
(1)

A general view, northwest from the Hotel St. George (not seen in this view, but which is located at 51 Clark Street at Hicks Street), showing at the right Hicks, north from Orange Streets. Note also the junction of all B.M.T. Elevated lines at the approach to the Brooklyn Bridge. At the extreme left is the East River.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, showing a more extensive view of the East River. The bridges, in the order named are: the Manhattan and the Williamsburg. Also seen in the background is a section of Manhattan.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - Brooklyn - Clark Street - Hotel St. George.

text:
(1) A general view northwest from the Hotel St. George, 51 Clark at Hicks Streets, showing Pineapple Street (left), north side, east to Fulton Street. In the foreground, is Henry Street, east side, between Orange and Pineapple Streets. January 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, a more limited view.

January 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing a further view eastward.

January 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

title: General View - Brooklyn - Hotel St. George.

text:
(1) A general view, northwest from the Hotel St. George, No. 51 Clark at Hicks Streets, showing in the center of view, Orange Street intersecting Hicks Street.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing more of the left background and the junction of all B.M.T. Elevated lines, at the approach to the Brooklyn Bridge.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, showing also the East River flowing north and south, and three of New York's famous bridges, the Brooklyn; Manhattan and Williamsburg.
June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General View - Brooklyn - Hotel St. George.

title: General View - Brooklyn - Hotel St. George.

text:
General view, southeast from the Hotel St. George, No. 51 Clark at Hicks Streets, showing at the left center, the Brooklyn Post Office Building (white). In the far background, is the Albee building.

June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - Brooklyn - Clark Street - Hotel St. George.

text:
A general view southwest from the Hotel St. George located at 51 Clark Street at Hicks Street, showing in the left foreground the Leverich Towers. At the right is Pineapple Street extending west of Hicks Street to Columbia Heights. In the background is a part of the Lower Manhattan skyline and the mouth of the North (Hudson) River. Piers shown on the Brooklyn side of the East River are Nos. 7, 8 and 9.

June 15, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General View - Brooklyn - Hotel St. George.
